result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen J. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

*Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:   Jeremy Haas and Kyle Orlowski 
*Participate in any counseling or assessments as deemed appropriate and recommended by the agent.

original filed in 15CF401

Defendant Allen J. Johnson in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases to have been heard today are 15CF401, 16CF54, 15CT302 and 15CT334.

10:46 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Defendant makes statements.
Atty Cousins makes statements.

Atty Redfield is now hear and it is approx. 10:50 a.m.
10:56 a.m.   Court re-calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF401:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - No contest
Count 3 - No contest

16CF54:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - DRI
Count 5 - No contest

15CT302:
Count 1- DRI

15CT334:
Count 1 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 2 & 3 of 15CF401 and Count 1 & 5 on 16CF54 and Count 1 of 15CF401 is DRI, Count 2-4 of 16CF54 are DRI, Count 1 of 15CT302 is DRI and Count 1 of 15CT334 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Redfield makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CF401:
Count 1 - DRI

Count 2 -
Sentence withheld
Placed on Probation for 18 months -
**Conditions of Probation:
Complete 50 hours of community service
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Maintain full-time employment.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Jeremy Haas and Kyle Orlowski
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.  
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Participate in any counseling or assessments as deemed appropriate and recommended by the agent.

Count 3 -
Sentence withheld
Placed on Probation for 18 months -
**Conditions of Probation:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 2 of 15CF401
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

16CF54:
Count 1 - 
Sentence withheld
Placed on Probation for 18 months -
**Conditions of Probation:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 2 of 15CF401
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - DRI

Count 5 -
10 day jail sentence - all can be completed on GPS electronic home monitor
60 days to commence
Report to jail today for start date
Pay $150 fine plus costs
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan

15CT302:
Count 1- DRI

15CT334:
Count 1 - DRI

Parties have received & reviewed the Competency Report. Parties stipulate to the report findings of competent to proceed. Court questions the Defendant. Preliminary waiver was done earlier and ready to proceed with the Arraignment today on 15CF401 and 16CF54.  All cases set for Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Allen J. Johnson in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
4:37 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Atty Redfield makes note that competency may be raised. 
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

Atty Redfield is prepared to proceed to arraignment. 
Atty Cousins would not like to proceed as competency may be an issue.  
  Arraignment scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Atty Redfield
Preliminary hearing at 01-04-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant Allen J. Johnson in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Defendant would like to consult with an attorney and states he has Jerod Redfield.
Atty Redfield shows up now.
Time limits waived.
Bond is continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance at 12-07-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Allen J. Johnson in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court questions the defendant re: representation. 
Defendant indicates he spoke with Atty Redfield.  He was told to have him appointed. 
Court informs the defendant he needs to go to the Public Defender's office first.  If he does not qualify, then he needs to complete the proper petition. 
Court questions the defendant further. 
Defendant indicates the attorney's he spoke with.  Atty Redfield will be representing him.  He just spoke to him. 

Bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
